column2: • Has the work area been set out for line and level?
Freq: Prior to start of Works
• Has the previous layer passed acceptance criteria?
Freq: Prior to start of works
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc):
• Is the correct material being used?
• Has the material to be used been approved for use (Material certificates to be provided)?
Freq: Prior to start of works
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc):
• Maximum lot size = 1 days production or 4000m2
Freq: Prior to start of works
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc):
• Is the pavement intended to be Lower Subbase or Upper Subbase?
Freq: Prior to start of works
• Transverse - Offset by not less than 2 m to any underlying pavement layers.
• Longitudinal - Offset by not less than 150 mm to any underlying pavement layers. Located within 300 mm of the traffic lane lines or within 300 mm of the centre of a traffic lane.
• Has all of the above been completed correctly and to a high standard?
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc):
• Place and compact layers so that the surface finish is smooth and uniform.

• The width of each side of the pavement shall not be less than the specified offset width or more than 50 mm outside the specified offset width when measured at right angles from the centre line or design line.
• No point > 8 mm below a 3 m straight edge in any direction
• No point >10 mm below a 6 m straight edge in any direction
• Has all of the above been completed correctly, to a high standard and approved?
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc):
• Has the material maintained at optimum moisture content (>85%), with additional water being added if required during compaction?
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc):
• Area shall withstand test rolling without visible deformation or springing.
• Has all of the above been completed correctly, to a high standard and approved by relevant authority?
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc):
2.6 - Identification of soft wet or unstable material
• What quantity of soft, wet or unstable material is present? (m2)
• What quantity of soft, wet or unstable material is present? (m3)
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc):
2.7 - Treatment of unsuitable material (Testing of material to be agreed on site)
• Has rectification process been submitted to VicRoads for Review?
• What was the rectification process used?
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc):
• Surface of each compacted layer in good order/condition & free from contamination until the subsequent pavement work is to commence.
• Has all of the above been completed?
• Characteristic Density Ratio % (six tests per lot): Not less than 98.0% Modified (Scale A)
• Characteristic Density Ratio % (six tests per lot): Not less than 97.0% Modified (Scale B)
• For layer directly beneath bituminous surface, not less than 100.0 for scale A and 98.0 for scale B
• Has all of the above been proven to meet and/or exceed minimum tested requirements?
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc):
• Test every lot for acceptance until three consecutive lot of like material and/or work have passed the requirements.
• For Subbase, one Characteristic Density Ration % (six tests) will be completed for every second lot.

• Testing will be completed at the minimum frequency until such time as a lot fails to achieve the specified requirements. After a failed result, all subsequent lots will be tested until three consecutive lots of like material and work have achieved the specified standard, at which time the frequency of testing may revert to the minimum frequency
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc):
• If using reduced frequency, provide lot number of previous lot tested:
• Surface after completion shall be smooth and uniform, free of segmented areas and conforming to grade, thickness and cross-section shown on the drawings.
• Surface level checked for compliance with 304.06:
○ Mean +6 mm to -10 mm with a max std deviation of 10 mm (Scale A)
○ Mean +8 mm to -16 mm with a max std deviation of 15 mm (Scale B)
• Has all of the above been proven to meet and/or exceed requirements set out in contract?
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc):

• All Test reports received and Reviewed as per Requirements for Testing and Acceptance of Surface Level Measurement, Compaction and Post-compaction Gradings and PIs (Clauses 304.06, 304.08, 304.10 and 304.11)
• Has all of the above been proven to meet and/or exceed minimum tested requirements?
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc):
• All Product Non-Conformance(s) recorded and closed (if applicable)
• Has all of the above been proven to meet and/or exceed minimum tested requirements?
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc):
Date NCR closed for this lot
